title: Virgil Quick Start
description: Get up and running with Virgil in 5 steps

steps.title: Welcome to Virgil
steps.body:
Virgil is an extension that provides interactive guided walkthroughs for any codebase.

This quick start will show you the basics:
- How walkthroughs activate
- How to navigate between steps
- How to create your own walkthroughs

steps.title: Extension activates on walkthrough files
steps.body:
Virgil activates when it detects any `*.walkthrough.json` file in your workspace. The activation event is defined in package.json.

- Supports any filename ending in .walkthrough.json
- Multiple walkthroughs can coexist in one workspace

steps.title: Tree view shows walkthrough structure
steps.body:
The WalkthroughProvider parses the JSON and builds a tree view with the title and steps.

- Current step is highlighted with a green arrow
- Steps with file locations show a file-code icon
- Steps without locations show a note icon

steps.title: Navigate with keyboard shortcuts
steps.body:
Use Cmd+Shift+] for next step and Cmd+Shift+[ for previous step. These keybindings are defined in package.json.

- Keybindings only active when a walkthrough is loaded
- You can also click steps in the sidebar or use the panel buttons

steps.title: Next Steps
steps.body:
You're ready to use Virgil!

- Create *.walkthrough.json files to define guided tours
- Use the sidebar to navigate between steps
- Keyboard shortcuts make navigation fast

Check out virgil-architecture.walkthrough.json for a deeper dive into how the extension works.
